channel.title: Interleaved RSS Feed
channel.description: This is an interleaved feed of the most recent entries from each RSS source, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: The planet is getting hotter fast. This is what happens to your body in extreme heat
item.description: Human-caused climate change has already made heat waves around the world more frequent and intense.

item.title: Donald Sutherland, veteran actor and father of Kiefer Sutherland, dead at 88
item.description: His films include "Ordinary People," "The Hunger Games," "M*A*S*H" and more.

item.title: Why Nvidia, Super Micro Computer, Dell, and Other Artificial Intelligence (AI) Stocks Rallied This Week
item.description: Read more on this topic here

item.title: Oakland Mayor Sheng Thao's home raided by FBI agents
item.description: FBI agents conducted an early-morning raid on the home of Oakland Mayor Sheng Thao Thursday morning, removing several boxes of items.

item.title: The Juneteenth flag is full of symbols. Here's what they mean
item.description: Designing the Juneteenth flag was a deliberate process, says creator Ben Haith, who breaks down what each element of the flag represents.

item.title: Man critically injured after being struck by roller coaster
item.description: A 38-year-old man was critically injured at a Mason, Ohio amusement park Wednesday night after being hit by a roller coaster.

item.title: A US veteran died at a nursing home, abandoned. Hundreds of strangers came to say goodbye
item.description: Read more on this topic here

item.title: Philadelphia declares heat health emergency
item.description: Philadelphia health officials have declared a heat health emergency as temperatures are expected to rise above 90 degrees Fahrenheit in parts of the Northeast. CBS News' Lilia Luciano breaks down the health-related dangers.

item.title: June 18 2024: US heat wave news
item.description: A dangerous heat wave is scorching parts of the Midwest and Northeast. Record-breaking high temperatures are forecast across dozens of cities where cooling centers have been opened to protect the vulnerable.

item.title: Cruise ship rescues 68 migrants and finds 5 bodies in boat adrift in Atlantic Ocean
item.description: Spanish rescuers say that a cruise ship has rescued 68 migrants and found five bodies in a wooden dinghy that was drifting off the Canary Islands in the Atlantic Ocean

item.title: American Airlines CEO says the removal of several Black passengers from a flight was 'unacceptable'
item.description: Read more on this topic here

item.title: Alberto causes widespread flooding in Texas, weakens to tropical depression
item.description: Alberto weakened into a tropical depression Thursday morning after bringing heavy rains to parts of Mexico and flooding Texas shores. CBS News' Dave Malkoff spoke to tourists stranded in floodwaters as new weather systems loom nearby.

item.title: 'I know it happens': Boeing chief admits the company has retaliated against whistleblowers
item.description: The outgoing chief of the embattled airplane maker is testifying in the wake of a whistleblower's allegations of safety issues.

item.title: Biden campaign picks right-side podium for CNN debate, Trump will have the last word
item.description: Biden won a coin toss to secure a position on the right side of the stage during next week's debate, but by doing so allowed Trump to have the debate's last word.

item.title: Gorsuch chastises Supreme Court majority in drug trafficking case dissent
item.description: Read more on this topic here

item.title: Donald Sutherland, star of "M*A*S*H," "Hunger Games," dies at 88
item.description: Donald Sutherland, a multi-generational actor who starred in "M*A*S*H," "Hunger Games" and more, died at 88.

item.title: June 17, 2024 - Israel-Gaza news
item.description: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu has disbanded the country's war cabinet, an Israeli official says, just over a week after opposition leader Benny Gantz withdrew from the body.

item.title: In Atlanta, Yellen announces sanctions against Mexican cartel
item.description: U.S., Treasury Secretary Janet Yellen has announced new sanctions against members of La Nueva Familia Michoacana drug cartel, a notoriously violent group that wars for territorial control with a slate of other Mexican cartels

item.title: Trump Flips Out Over Devastating Fox News Poll
item.description: Read more on this topic here

item.title: Donald Sutherland, "Hunger Games," "M*A*S*H" actor, dies at 88
item.description: Actor Donald Sutherland, who appeared in more than 150 films and television shows like "M*A*S*H," Animal House" and "Hunger Games," has died, CBS News confirms. Sutherland was 88.
